root.name: map()
root.description:
Re-maps a number from one range to another. In the example above, the number '25' is converted from a value in the range 0..100 into a value that ranges from the left edge (0) to the right edge (width) of the screen.
Numbers outside the range are not clamped to 0 and 1, because out-of-range values are often intentional and useful.

parameter.label: value
parameter.description: float: The incoming value to be converted

parameter.label: low1
parameter.description: float: Lower bound of the value's current range

parameter.label: high1
parameter.description: float: Upper bound of the value's current range

parameter.label: low2
parameter.description: float: Lower bound of the value's target range

parameter.label: high2
parameter.description: float: Upper bound of the value's target range
